item.title: Taste for takeaways outlasts Covid lockdowns
item.description: Britons are spending more on home delivered meals than before the pandemic struck.

item.title: UK business confidence jumps to more than four-year high, survey finds
item.description: Lloyds survey finds North West England leads level of confidence despite caution over inflation.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Toyota restarts driverless vehicles after accident
item.description: A visually impaired athlete from Japan's judo team was hit by one of the e-Palette pods on Thursday.

item.title: Theranos scandal: Who is Elizabeth Holmes and why is she on trial?
item.description: The former boss of blood testing company Theranos is accused of fraud and could face years in jail.

item.title: Nike is giving its head office staff a week's break
item.description: The sports shoe giant is giving US head office staff this week off after a "traumatic" year.

item.title: Covid threatens Singapore's business hub crown
item.description: The South East Asian country faces opposing pressures over the large number of workers from overseas.

item.title: Affordable uniforms law will miss new school year
item.description: Parents are concerned that a law to make school uniforms cheaper will not be in place for September.

item.title: China cuts children's online gaming to one hour
item.description: Regulators are restricting game-playing for under 18s to an hour on Fridays, weekends and holidays

item.title: Give UK workers four more bank holidays a year, says TUC
item.description: The trades union body says having just eight public holidays in England and Wales is "stingy" .

item.title: Vietnam lockdown adds to global coffee supply concerns
item.description: Wholesale coffee prices have risen by 50% this year as supplies have been hit around the world.

item.title: Covid travel: Latest changes begin as seven countries go green
item.description: People arriving from Canada and Denmark are among those who will not need to isolate for 10 days.

item.title: Suit you sir? Not any more at some M&S stores
item.description: The retailer no longer sells men's suits at more than half of its large stores as tastes turn casual.

item.title: Japan's huge army of under-employed ex-housewives
item.description: Why women are still battling for better jobs in the world's third largest economy.

item.title: The pubs and restaurants counting on Christmas cheer
item.description: In a bid to rebound from Covid plans for this year's festive season are under way.

item.title: CEO Secrets: 'Tear up the business plan'
item.description: CEO Secrets: Brooklyn Brewery boss Eric Ottaway says - be ready to ditch your business plan.

item.title: Can the US crack down on fake vaccination cards?
item.description: As more people are asked to prove vaccination status, a black market in fake health cards has boomed.

item.title: How to keep your cool when the office heats up
item.description: Buildings that are too hot are bad for your health and productivity but simple measures can help.

item.title: Why phone scams are so difficult to tackle
item.description: Phone fraud, both via calls and text messages, has soared during the pandemic.

item.title: Brazil hopes the world will get a taste for its favourite spirit
item.description: With domestic sales of cachaÃ§a falling last year, Brazilian producers want to export more.

item.title: Love and money: Why breaking-up is so hard to do
item.description: More people are looking for help in paying for divorces after relationships ended during Covid.

item.title: CEO Secrets: Don't ask for all your funding up front
item.description: Don't ask for all your funding at once, says Zazuu CEO Kay Akinwunmi, but in smaller chunks.

item.title: Never mind going electric, where will we park?
item.description: UK roads are already jam-packed and that looks set to get worse as more people snap up EVs.

item.title: Just how hard is it to recycle a jumbo jet?
item.description: Thousands of aircraft were left on the tarmac due to Covid, and many will now be broken up for parts.

item.title: Would you let a robot lawyer defend you?
item.description: Why artificial intelligence is increasingly being used by the legal profession.
